file_content.text: Pleasure working with you.
Colonel Vrain is the man in charge. He knows how to finish this.
No more surprise attacks. Good. Captain Rigel is on holo. He wants a word with you.
My lord, allow me to express my deepest pleasure at working with you. Operation Breaking Point has been far more successful than I ever could've imagined.
I asked you to do a job, and you sure outdid yourselves. We'll all have medals by the end of this one.
Word is, the former Balmorran Minister of Defense, Vol Argen, might come down to Balmorra. He's playing right into our hands.
I hope he does show up. I'll kill him.
He'll die like the rest.
I hope so, too.
Thank you.
What's the last mission?
Let's finish this.
Well, that's part of why I called.
Now that the wilds are secured, we're ready for the final push. Colonel Vrain, head of the Imperial Conquest Consolidation Corps, has come to oversee the action.
He's at the Sundari Outpost, in striking distance of the resistance's main base. It's now or never.
Stealthed fighters. Gorinth Wilds. Watch for the mines. Strike quickly. Strike to kill.
My lord. My respects.
How do you like Balmorra so far? Doesn't seem like much, does it?
Agent. I hear you represent your Empire well.
How do you like Balmorra so far? Hard to believe there's so much fighting over so little.
Hunter. Your business is death.
A friend of the Imperials. Good.
How do you like Balmorra so far? Worthless, isn't it? But full of death.
As war zones go, it's not so bad.
I've seen worse.
Hmm. Then you haven't been here long enough.
I thought this was an Imperial operation.
You don't sound Imperial.
I thought the lieutenant would've told you. I'm Balmorran. But I'm also a businessman. Patriotism is bad for business. So is death, but only to a point.
Let's just get to the mission.
Get to the point.
Resistance stealth troops have been infiltrating Imperial outposts, making quick strikes and leaving no trace.
The Empire says they can't be beaten. I say they can.
What did you have in mind?
What are you thinking?
How would you know how to beat them?
Because?
What's so scary about them?
I'm not afraid of them.
You don't see them until they kill you. That's what they say. But I built the tech they use to keep hidden.
Their camp's in the Gorinth Wilds, but they've surrounded it with mines to keep strangers out. Watch your step, and you can use this device to detect the stealthed fighters.
They're fast, though. If I may offer advice: strike quick and hard.
Can't talk. Busy.
